description.en:
The Atari 600XL was, like its predecessor the 1200XL, short lived. In production for only a year, the 'Liz NY' model was the spritual replacement for the Atari 400.
 
Although they looked like the 1200XL, albeit smaller, the new XL machines had features the 1200XL lacked: internal BASIC and a Parallel Bus Interface (PBI) at the back that allowed external expansion.
 
The best known PBI expansion peripheral was the 1064 memory expansion for the 600XL.
